content.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, minus 16, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, the fraction 1 over u, end fraction, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="u equals, x squared, minus 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over 2 x, end fraction, times the indefinite integral of, the fraction 1 over u, end fraction, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="u equals, x squared, minus 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one eighth times the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x, minus, one eighth times the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x plus 4, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x, plus, the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x plus 4, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one eighth times the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x, minus, one eighth times the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x plus 4, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
